episodeTitle: Buggy's Revenge! The Man who Smiles at the Execution Platform!
episodeTitleJapanese: バギーのリベンジ！処刑台で笑う男！
episodeTitleRomanized: Bagī no ribenji! Shokeidai de warau otoko!
description: Luffy climbs the execution platform where Gold Roger died, but Buggy and Alvida ambush him with the intent to execute him publicly. In a dramatic parallel to Roger's death, Luffy smiles in the face of execution. A mysterious lightning bolt strikes the platform, saving Luffy. As the Straw Hats attempt to escape, Smoker moves to capture them, but a mysterious hooded figure—Dragon—intervenes, allowing the crew to escape toward the Grand Line.

events.title: Luffy Climbs the Execution Platform
events.description: Luffy climbs onto the legendary execution platform where Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King, was executed 22 years ago. He stands at the same spot where the greatest pirate in history met his end.
events.significance: This moment symbolically connects Luffy to Gold Roger and foreshadows his destiny as a great pirate. The platform serves as a pivotal location throughout this episode.

quotes.text: So this is where the King of the Pirates died...
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy reflecting on standing where Roger was executed

events.title: Alvida Explains Her Devil Fruit Powers
events.description: Alvida reveals to Luffy that she ate the Sube Sube no Mi (Slip-Slip Fruit), which transformed her body to be perfectly smooth and slippery. This Devil Fruit caused all her excess weight to slip off, giving her a beautiful, slim appearance.
events.significance: This is the first time Alvida explicitly explains her Devil Fruit powers to Luffy, confirming the source of her dramatic transformation since their first encounter.

quotes.text: I ate the Sube Sube no Mi! It makes my body smooth and everything just slips right off me!
quotes.speaker: Alvida
quotes.context: Alvida explaining her Devil Fruit powers to Luffy

events.title: Buggy Traps Luffy on the Execution Platform
events.description: Buggy and his crew, allied with Alvida, ambush Luffy on the execution platform. Cabaji leaps from hiding and locks Luffy in a wooden stockade, trapping him in the same position where Gold Roger was executed.
events.significance: This sets up the dramatic climax of the Loguetown Arc, with Buggy seeking revenge for his earlier defeat. The parallel to Roger's execution becomes a central theme.

quotes.text: Straw Hat Luffy! You will die here today, just like Gold Roger!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy declaring his intention to execute Luffy

events.title: Luffy Smiles in the Face of Death
events.description: As Buggy raises his blade to execute Luffy, Luffy accepts his fate with a smile and shouts to Zoro and Sanji that 'Sorry, I'm dead!' This echoes Gold Roger's demeanor at his own execution 22 years prior, stunning all witnesses including Smoker.
events.significance: This is one of the most important character moments in the series, establishing the deep parallel between Luffy and Gold Roger. Both faced death with a smile, demonstrating their fearless spirits and unwavering resolve.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's last words before execution, said with a smile

quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker recognizing the parallel to Gold Roger's execution

events.title: Lightning Strikes the Execution Platform
events.description: Just as Buggy's blade is about to strike Luffy's neck, a massive bolt of lightning from a sudden storm strikes the execution platform. The lightning destroys the platform and shocks everyone except Luffy, who is unharmed due to his rubber body. The platform collapses, freeing Luffy.
events.significance: This mysterious lightning strike saves Luffy's life and raises questions about fate, divine intervention, or Dragon's powers. It becomes one of the great mysteries of the series and demonstrates Luffy's incredible luck or destiny.

quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy's shock as lightning strikes the platform

events.title: Straw Hats Escape Toward the Ship
events.description: With Luffy freed by the lightning, the Straw Hat crew makes a desperate dash back to the Going Merry. Zoro and Sanji had been fighting Buggy's crew to rescue Luffy, but now all retreat together as Marines pursue them.
events.significance: The crew demonstrates their loyalty and teamwork as they race to escape Loguetown before Smoker can capture them.

events.title: Smoker Captures Buggy and Alvida
events.description: Using special Seastone nets designed to neutralize Devil Fruit powers, Smoker and his Marines capture Buggy, Alvida, and their crew members. Despite their Devil Fruit abilities, they are powerless against the Seastone.
events.significance: This demonstrates the effectiveness of Seastone against Devil Fruit users and shows Smoker's tactical competence. It also removes Buggy and Alvida from the immediate story.

events.title: Smoker Confronts Luffy
events.description: Smoker catches up to Luffy near the docks and prepares to capture him using his Smoke-Smoke Fruit powers. As a Logia-type Devil Fruit user, Smoker is nearly invulnerable to physical attacks, putting Luffy at a severe disadvantage.
events.significance: This confrontation establishes Smoker as a recurring antagonist who will pursue Luffy throughout the Grand Line. It also shows the power gap between Luffy and Logia users.

quotes.text: You're not getting away, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker confronting Luffy before he can escape

events.title: Monkey D. Dragon's Debut
events.description: A mysterious man in a green hooded cloak with a distinctive facial tattoo appears in Loguetown. He intervenes as Smoker is about to capture Luffy, stopping the Marine Captain with his presence alone. Dragon declares that he sees no reason to stop a man from pursuing his destiny.
events.significance: This is the first appearance of Monkey D. Dragon, Luffy's father and leader of the Revolutionary Army—one of the most wanted men in the world. His intervention saves Luffy and sets up major future plot developments.

quotes.text: I see no reason to stop a man from setting sail.
quotes.speaker: Dragon
quotes.context: Dragon explaining why he's helping Luffy escape

events.title: Dragon Stops Smoker with Wind
events.description: As Dragon intervenes, a powerful gust of wind suddenly throws Smoker back, preventing him from capturing Luffy. The wind appears to be connected to Dragon's presence, though his exact powers remain mysterious.
events.significance: This scene hints at Dragon's weather-related abilities and raises questions about whether he caused the lightning that saved Luffy earlier. It establishes Dragon as an incredibly powerful individual.

events.title: Dragon Speaks of the Storm of Fate
events.description: As he watches Luffy escape, Dragon cryptically states that a 'storm' is coming. He observes the events with a knowing smile, suggesting he is aware of Luffy's potential and destiny.
events.significance: Dragon's words about an approaching storm suggest he foresees major changes coming to the world, likely connected to Luffy's journey and the Revolutionary Army's goals.

quotes.text: The winds of fate have begun to blow...
quotes.speaker: Dragon

events.title: Straw Hats Escape on the Going Merry
events.description: The Straw Hat crew successfully boards the Going Merry and sets sail from Loguetown. The storm's rain has wet the Marines' gunpowder, preventing them from firing their cannons. The crew escapes toward the Grand Line.
events.significance: This marks the end of the East Blue Saga and the Loguetown Arc. The crew is now ready to enter the Grand Line, the most dangerous sea in the world.

events.title: Smoker Decides to Pursue Luffy into the Grand Line
events.description: Despite orders, Smoker decides to pursue the Straw Hat Pirates into the Grand Line. Tashigi joins him, both abandoning their posts in Loguetown to chase after Luffy and Zoro respectively.
events.significance: This establishes Smoker and Tashigi as recurring characters who will continue to pursue the Straw Hats throughout their journey, adding Marine pressure to future arcs.

quotes.text: I'm going after them. Into the Grand Line if I have to.
quotes.speaker: Smoker

themes.description: The episode draws powerful parallels between Luffy and Gold Roger, suggesting that Luffy may be inheriting Roger's will and destiny as a great pirate.
themes.symbolism: The execution platform serves as a symbol connecting the past (Roger's execution) to the future (Luffy's journey). Both men smile in the face of death, showing their fearless spirits.

themes.description: The mysterious lightning bolt that saves Luffy raises questions about fate, luck, and destiny. Is Luffy protected by fate, or does he create his own luck?
themes.symbolism: The storm and lightning represent the unpredictable forces that seem to protect and guide Luffy on his journey.

themes.description: Dragon's intervention on behalf of Luffy introduces the theme of hidden family connections and the mysterious role Dragon plays in world events.
themes.symbolism: Dragon remains hooded and mysterious, representing the secrets about Luffy's family that will be revealed throughout the series.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his fearless nature and unwavering spirit by smiling in the face of death, cementing his parallel to Gold Roger and foreshadowing his destiny as a legendary pirate.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the action sequences and added more dramatic tension to the execution scene compared to the manga's faster pacing.
The anime shows more detail of the storm and lightning strike, with enhanced visual effects not present in the black-and-white manga.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts the manga's landmark 100th chapter, titled 'The Legend Has Begun,' marking a significant milestone in the One Piece story.
The lightning strike that saves Luffy remains one of the series' great mysteries. It's never been explicitly confirmed whether it was caused by Dragon, pure luck, or divine intervention.
Hidekatsu Shibata, who voices Dragon in Japanese, was 63 years old when he first voiced the character in this episode. He continues to voice Dragon today at nearly 90 years old.
This episode marks the end of the East Blue Saga and serves as a transition point before the crew enters the Grand Line.
The 4Kids English dub split this episode into two parts (their episodes 42 and 43) due to their different episode structure.
Pandaman, Oda's signature hidden character, makes a cameo appearance in the crowd during this episode.
